title: Gray Ghost 2017 Riesling (Virginia)
description: A demure nose of lemon, orange peel and green apple starts this off. The palate is more intense in its apple and lemon curd flavors, with racy acidity on the finish.

title: Grey's Peak 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Waipara Valley)
description: Ripe tropical and passion fruit along with wild mint, butter and a flinty minerality are slightly hidden in this gold-hued wine. The full-bodied palate is round and rich, with just enough acidity to keep things refreshing. A salty herbaceousness is present right through to the finish.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Titolato Strozzi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals pressed acacia, Spanish broom and beeswax aromas. On the ripe, round palate, bitter almond underscores mature yellow apple and citrus rind flavors.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Alluring scents of Spanish broom, beeswax and wild herbs mingle with orchard fruit aromas in this wine. On the round palate, a honeyed note underscores mature yellow apple and citrus rind flavors. A bitter almond note signals the close.

title: Hannes Reeh 2016 Zweigelt (Neusiedlersee)
description: Fleshy black cherry displays its ripeness on the nose. The palate has the same ripe juiciness but also a dollop of freshness to counter it. This is easygoing, utterly-fruit-driven and for immediate drinking.

title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2015 Late Harvest Riesling (Seneca Lake)
description: Grassy herbs, gooseberry and slate make for an atypical aroma for a late harvest Riesling. The palate brings more familiar melon and chalky apple flavors, with a mild vein of acidity carrying to a peach-fuzz finish.

title: Idilico 2016 Albariño (Yakima Valley)
description: Coming from Dutchman Vineyard in the Yakima Valley, aromas of muscat, dried orange peel, honeydew melon rind and citrus are followed by full-feeling lightly spritzy tropical fruit flavors. It delivers appeal.

title: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2016 Selvabianca  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This organically grown wine's white spring flower and orchard fruit aromas form in the glass. The bright palate offers yellow apple, Anjou pear and nectarine flavors alongside fresh acidity.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Zinfandel (California)
description: Boysenberry and chocolate flavors flood the taste buds as this full-bodied and broad-textured wine fills the mouth with richness. It tastes lush and ripe, feels smooth and almost soft.

title: La Crema 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Toast, butter, lemon spray and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this widely available and reliable wine. It's fresh and zesty on the palate with lime peels and Meyer lemon juice, yet there are also creamy butter and blanched almond flavors to round out the palate.

title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Bonarda (Agrelo)
description: With a bold purple color and aromas of dark berry fruits and cassis, this is a lusty Bonarda with a jammy palate bolstered by firm acidity. Roasted peppery black-fruit flavors are beefy and a touch hot on the finish.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Dry Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Lemongrass, grapefruit peel and tonic are refreshing and clean on the nose. The lithe palate shows a bit more ripeness, with juicy peach on the fore that turns more lean and tart on the finish. Overall, this is quite enjoyable for its short burst of power.

title: Lapeyre 2016 Evidéncia White (Vin de France)
description: Producer Jean-Bernard Larrieu describes this unfiltered wine from organically grown grapes bottled without sulfur as libre or natural. It has a certain oxidative character with a touch of honey and smooth yellow fruit. Drink now.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2017 Cuvée G Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The high proportion of Syrah (55%) in this wine has given it intense acidity and a tight, crisp and perfumed character. It is refreshing, lively, packed with fruit and ready to drink.

title: Lightwell Survey 2015 The Weird Ones are Wolves Cabernet Franc (Shenandoah Valley)
description: Far from your run of the mill Cabernet Franc, layers of complexity begin with aromas of mint, black-currant leaf, eucalyptus, coffee and spice. Well-integrated tannins and kinetic acidity lend themselves to a long and deep finish.

title: Lucchetti 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: Jasmine, white peach and chamomile hints merge together in this. The linear palate offers grapefruit and Bosc pear notes alongside bright acidity that leaves a refreshing finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Lungarotti 2014 Rubesco Red (Torgiano)
description: Made from 90% Sangiovese and 10% Colorino, this has violet and kitchen spice aromas. The medium-bodied palate shows red cherry, raspberry jam and clove notes alongside fresh acidity and lithe tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Madonnina del Chiaro 2015 Damiani  (Chianti)
description: Subtle black-skinned berry, baking spice and white pepper aromas come together in this. The savory palate doles out ripe black plum, star anise and tangerine zest notes alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Marrenon 2017 Grande Toque White (Luberon)
description: Crisp, cutting gooseberry and white grapefruit notes are shaded by smoked nut and fresh herb hints in this medium-bodied white. Dry and intently mineral on the palate, it finishes on an invigorating lemon-lime flavor.

title: Mas Carlot 2017 L'Irresistible Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Still closed when tasted in March 2018, this delicate rosé's earth and smoke notes give way to concentrated raspberry and strawberry flavors after hearty aeration. Full bodied and richly textured, it's calibrated by refreshing acidity and a firm, mineral finish.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Midnight Red (Napa Valley)
description: Muted on the nose, this blend of 52% Petit Verdot, 44% Malbec, 2% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Sauvignon is hearty and thickly extracted, the fruit red and highly strung, with herbal components taking on prominence as the wine opens.

title: Mirabeau 2017 Pure Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This lightly structured wine is crisp and refreshing. Strawberry and citrus come together harmoniously, given dryness by the mineral texture. A touch of spice at the end gives a bite. Drink now.

title: Mud House 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc offers up peach and pear juice, tropical fruit, tomato leaf and green bell pepper on the nose. It's silky and slippery, with an approachable, easygoing vibe about it.

title: Naggiar 2017 Mamma Mia Estate White (Sierra Foothills)
description: Appley floral aromas meet rich ripe apple and pear flavors in this generous mouthfilling and smooth-textured wine. It is medium bodied, fragrant and easy to enjoy, especially with an appetizer like smoked trout.

title: Netzl 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Carnuntum)
description: Hints of lemon zest and moss on the nose signal appetizing freshness. On the light palate, this freshness is helped along by a bit of spritz and more zestiness and a hint of yeasty pepperiness—very moreish.

title: Numbskull 2016 G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Mostly Syrah (82%) along with pinches of Grenache (12%) and Mourvèdre (6%), the aromas leap up, with notes of boysenberry pie, herb, fresh flower and raspberry. The flavors are lighter styled, missing in the middle, with a blue-fruit-filled finish.

title: Ogier 2017 Artesis White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Whiffs of dusty mineral and smoke introduce this dry, medium-bodied white. The palate offers delicate apple and pear flavors accented by hazelnut notes and fresh white grapefruit-like acidity. A spry, neatly balanced wine to enjoy now–2020.

title: Palagetto 2015 Arianna Ventanni  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Shy at first, this reveals acacia, dried herb and white stone fruit aromas as it opens. They carry over to the palate, along with white peach and ginger notes. A hint of bitter almond backs up the finish.

title: Palagetto 2016 Santa Chiara  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's delicate spring flower, citrus and yellow stone fruit scents lift out of the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, a white almond note underscores yellow peach and juicy pineapple flavors.

title: Palma 2016  Chianti Superiore
description: Dark berry and scorched earth aromas lead the nose of this wine while the savory palate offers black plum, star anise and black pepper flavors. It's easygoing, with smooth tannins. Drink soon.
